question: Which one was the major towns in the Satavahana kingdom?
explanation: Paithan, formerly Pratiṣṭhana, is a town with municipal council in Aurangabad district, Maharashtra, India. Paithan is located 56 kilometres south of present-day Aurangabad on the Godavari River. It was the capital of the Satavahana dynasty, which ruled from the second century BCE to the second century CE.
